abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Kotlinlong; with &AWS;.

chapter.para: The code examples in this topic show you how to use the &Kotlinlong; with &AWS;.

variablelist.para: The examples are divided into the following categories:

listitem.para: Code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Sample applications that work across multiple &AWS; services.

abstract.para: The following code examples show how to implement common scenarios and perform individual service actions by using &Kotlin; with &AWS; services.

section.para: The following code examples show how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Kotlinlong; with &AWS; services.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual service functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple functions within the same service.
Services

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Kotlinlong; with &CW;.

section.para: The following code examples show you how to perform actions and implement common scenarios by using the &Kotlinlong; with &CW;.
Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &CW; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &CW; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.

info.title: Create an alarm that watches a metric
info.titleabbrev: Create an alarm that watches a metric

section.para: The following code example shows how to create an &CWlong; alarm that watches a metric.
The following code example shows how to delete &CWlong; alarms.
The following code example shows how to describe &CWlong; alarms for a metric.
The following code example shows how to disable &CWlong; alarm actions.
The following code example shows how to enable &CWlong; alarm actions.

info.title: Get started using tables, items, and queries
info.titleabbrev: Get started using tables, items, and queries

section.para: The following code example shows how to:

listitem.para: Create a table that can hold movie data.
Put, get, and update a single movie in the table.
Write movie data to the table from a sample JSON file.
Query for movies that were released in a given year.
Scan for movies that were released in a range of years.
Delete a movie from the table.
Delete the table.

section.para: The following code example shows how to query a &DDB; table using PartiQL.

info.title: Get started running crawlers and jobs
info.titleabbrev: Get started running crawlers and jobs

section.para: The following code example shows how to:

listitem.para: Create and run a crawler that crawls a public &S3long; (&S3;) bucket and generates a metadata database that describes the CSV-formatted data it finds.
List information about databases and tables in your &GLUDCLong;.
Create and run a job that extracts CSV data from the source &S3; bucket, transforms it by removing and renaming fields, and loads JSON-formatted output into another &S3; bucket.
List information about job runs and view some of the transformed data.
Delete all resources created by the demo.

section.para: For more information, see Tutorial: Getting started with &GLU; Studio.

abstract.para: Code examples that show how to use &Kotlinlong; with &LAM;.

Actions are code excerpts that show you how to call individual &LAM; functions.
Scenarios are code examples that show you how to accomplish a specific task by calling multiple &LAM; functions.
Each example includes a link to GitHub, where you can find instructions on how to set up and run the code in context.
The following code example shows how to create a &LAM; function.
The following code example shows how to delete a &LAM; function.
The following code example shows how to invoke a &LAM; function.
The following code example shows how to:

listitem.para: Create an &IAMlong; (&IAM;) role that grants Lambda permission to write to logs.
Create a &LAM; function and upload handler code.
Invoke the function with a single parameter and get results.
Update the function code and configure its &LAM; environment with an environment variable.
Invoke the function with new parameters and get results. Display the execution log that's returned from the invocation.
List the functions for your account.
Delete the &IAM; role and the &LAM; function.

section.para: For more information, see Create a &LAM; function with the console.

info.titleabbrev: Compare faces in an image against a reference image

For more information, see Comparing faces in images.
The following code example shows how to create an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Creating a collection.
The following code example shows how to delete an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Deleting a collection.
The following code example shows how to delete faces from an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Deleting faces from a collection.

For more information, see Describing a collection.

For more information, see Detecting faces in an image.
The following code example shows how to detect labels in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Detecting labels in an image.

info.title: Detect moderation labels in an image
info.titleabbrev: Detect moderation labels in an image

section.para: The following code example shows how to detect moderation labels in an image with &REK;. Moderation labels identify content that may be inappropriate for some audiences.
For more information, see Detecting inappropriate images.
The following code example shows how to detect text in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Detecting text in an image.
The following code example shows how to index faces in an image and add them to an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Adding faces to a collection.
The following code example shows how to list &REK; collections.
For more information, see Listing collections.
The following code example shows how to list faces in an &REK; collection.
For more information, see Listing faces in a collection.
The following code example shows how to recognize celebrities in an image with &REK;.
For more information, see Recognizing celebrities in an image.
The following code example shows how to detect information in videos.
